channel.description: Recent content in async on A Place for Poor Examples

item.title: Derby.js - Playing with Models
item.description: Been playing around with Derby in my spare time. The idea behind the platform is smart - using node and express, you write one set of code, and that code automatically syncs data between browsers, servers, and a database. Derby is still raw. The documentation is comprehensive but puts important information about the same topic in different places. I’ve culled the following eight lines of documentation of defining models from the documentation:

item.title: Some node.js and express.js beginner help
item.description: I’ve just started using node.js with express.js on both Windows (with iisnode) and Ubuntu. I love the stack (one programming language from front to back!), but some of the documentation has been frustrating for me. I wanted to document what I’ve learned so far in the hopes that it’ll help someone else down the line. Generate the starter app At first, I wanted to just hack away some of the existing example apps that were out there.
